title: Create monthly expenditure tracker with category-wise breakdown and savings calculation

requirements.text: Create a backend data model to store expense entries with fields: id, amount, category, description, date, and timestamp
acceptanceCriteria: Expense entries can be created with all required fields
Each expense has a unique identifier
Date and timestamp are properly stored for chronological tracking

requirements.text: Create a backend data model to store monthly earnings with fields: id, amount, month, year, and timestamp
acceptanceCriteria: Earnings can be set for specific months and years
Only one earnings entry per month-year combination
Amount is stored as a numeric value

requirements.text: Implement backend functions to add, update, delete, and retrieve expense entries
acceptanceCriteria: Expenses can be added with validation
Expenses can be updated by id
Expenses can be deleted by id
Expenses can be retrieved filtered by date range

requirements.text: Implement backend functions to set and retrieve monthly earnings
acceptanceCriteria: Monthly earnings can be set or updated for a specific month and year
Monthly earnings can be retrieved for a specific month and year
Returns zero or appropriate default when no earnings are set

requirements.text: Implement backend function to calculate total expenses by category for a given month and year
acceptanceCriteria: Returns a list of categories with their total expense amounts
Calculation is accurate for the specified month and year
Handles empty categories appropriately

requirements.text: Implement backend function to calculate savings as the difference between monthly earnings and total expenses for a given month and year

quotes: savings done out of total earnings

acceptanceCriteria: Savings calculation is accurate (earnings minus total expenses)
Returns negative values when expenses exceed earnings
Works correctly when no earnings are set

requirements.text: Create a frontend form to add new expense entries with fields for amount, category, description, and date
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields before submission
Category can be selected from predefined options or entered as custom text
Date defaults to current date but can be changed
Success feedback is shown after successful submission

requirements.text: Create a frontend form to set or update monthly earnings for a specific month and year
acceptanceCriteria: User can input monthly earnings amount
Month and year can be selected
Form validates positive numeric input
Success feedback is shown after saving

requirements.text: Create a frontend dashboard displaying category-wise expense breakdown for the selected month, showing each category with its total amount and percentage of total expenses
acceptanceCriteria: Categories are listed with their total expense amounts
Percentage breakdown is calculated and displayed for each category
Data updates when a different month is selected
Visual representation makes it easy to compare categories

requirements.text: Create a frontend summary section displaying total earnings, total expenses, and calculated savings for the selected month

quotes: savings done out of total earnings

acceptanceCriteria: Shows monthly earnings prominently
Shows total expenses for the month
Shows calculated savings (earnings minus expenses)
Visual indicators distinguish positive savings from negative (overspending)
Updates when month selection changes

requirements.text: Create a frontend list view displaying all individual expense entries for the selected month with options to edit or delete each entry
acceptanceCriteria: All expenses for the selected month are listed
Each entry shows date, category, description, and amount
Edit functionality allows modifying existing expenses
Delete functionality removes expenses with confirmation
List updates in real-time after add, edit, or delete operations

requirements.text: Implement month and year selector in the frontend to allow users to view data for different months
acceptanceCriteria: User can select month and year from dropdown or calendar picker
Default selection is the current month and year
All dashboard data updates when selection changes
Selection persists during the session

requirements.text: Design a cohesive visual theme with warm, approachable colors (such as earthy tones or soft gradients), clean typography with good hierarchy for numbers and categories, and a card-based layout that separates summary metrics, category breakdown, and expense details into distinct, scannable sections
acceptanceCriteria: Visual theme is consistent across all pages and components
Color scheme enhances readability and creates visual hierarchy
Layout is intuitive and makes financial data easy to scan
Typography clearly distinguishes monetary values from labels

requirements.text: Display generated images as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated in the appropriate UI locations
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are properly loaded from the static assets directory
Images are displayed with appropriate sizing and positioning
Fallback handling exists if images fail to load

constraints: All backend logic must be implemented in a single Motoko actor file
Frontend must use React with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and React Query
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity hooks, useActor.ts, main.tsx, and ui components
nonGoals: Multi-user authentication or user-specific data isolation
Export functionality to PDF or CSV
Historical trend analysis across multiple months
Mobile-specific responsive optimizations beyond standard responsive design

required: Financial growth illustration showing upward trend with coins or savings concept in warm tones (financial-growth.dim_400x300.png)
Category icons set including food, transport, entertainment, utilities, and shopping in a cohesive style (category-icons.dim_200x200.png)
